page.title: 11Changes in Brinklow
page.content: Mr. Poxon,a tenant farmer at Brierley's farm and also Chairman of the Parish Council,has seen some changes that he has liked and some he dislikes during the 25 years he has lived in Brinklow.At one time there were several smaller farms in the area but these have amalgamated to form the larger farming units that he prefers.At one time farmers were able to drive the cattle along the main road but because of the increase in traffic they now have to transport them by lorry to wherever they want to take them.Mr. Poxon thinks that the busy main road now causes lots of problems for people trying to cross it.He says that Brinklow is a village community and he hopes that it can be kept that way.
